title: CaC2 calorimetry - pH of product mixture

content.question: At the completion of the reaction, the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>pH</mi></math> of the product mixture is measured to be above <math alttext="7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn></math>. Which of the following can be concluded from this result?

choices.label: <math alttext="C a O H 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Ca(OH)</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is slightly soluble in water.

<math alttext="C 2 H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is a proton donor.

<math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is the limiting reactant.
The final temperature of the mixture is below <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mo rspace="0em">Â°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="C a O H 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Ca(OH)</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is slightly soluble in water.

topic.text: 8.2: pH and pOH of Strong Acids and Bases

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
